example.text: Often the genteel, conservative, long-term-oriented investment bankers were displaced by crude traders: ``When angered, he cursed so forcefully that his face reddened and his pale-blue eyes narrowed into tiny slits,'' the authors say of Lehman's Lewis Glucksman.

example.name: Bare utterance
example.text: As her life ended she cursed him, "you shall live the lifetime of every soul that you have caused death today."
